intro: Conyza boranensis, commonly known as African dandelion, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and serrated leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in clusters, followed by white, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. It is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural areas.
